danish_publication: Den gamle Kræn Mejlhedes fader var en aften ude at flytte bæsterne. Da han kom tilbage og vilde gå tværs over vejen, hørte han ved diget en stærk puslen, og så kom der en hovedløs hest med vejen, og rytteren var også hovedløs. Det tog efter byen til, og røgen stod langt æfor ud af hestens næse. "A stræbte misæl at komme hjem, for a blev ræd," sagde han, da han fortalte det.
english_publication: Old Kræn Mejlhede’s father was out one night to move the animals. When he was coming back and was going to cross the road, he heard down by the wall a loud rustling and then a headless horse came along the road, and the rider was also headless. They went off towards the town, and steam came far out of the horse’s nose. “I hurried on home, since I got scared,” he said when he told about it.
